com.github.robtimus.net.ip

Class IPv6Address

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.robtimus.net.ip.IPAddress<IPv6Address>
      • com.github.robtimus.net.ip.IPv6Address
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<IPv6Address>

    public final class IPv6Address
extends IPAddress<IPv6Address>
    Represents an IPv6 address. Immutable.
    Author:
    Rob Spoor

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static IPv6Address LOCALHOST
      An IPv6 address object for localhost, ::1.
      static IPv6Address MAX_VALUE
      The maximum IPv6 address object, ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff.
      static IPv6Address MIN_VALUE
      The minimum IPv6 address object, ::.

    • Method Detail

      • bits

        public int bits()
        Returns the number of bits required to store the IP address, always 128.
        Specified by:
        bits in class IPAddress<IPv6Address>
        Returns:
        The number of bits required to store the IP address.

      • toByteArray

        public byte[] toByteArray()
        Description copied from class: IPAddress
        Returns a byte array representation of this IP address. Its size is equal to IPAddress.bits() divided by Byte.SIZE. Furthermore, the result is in network byte order; the highest order byte is in the first element.
        Specified by:
        toByteArray in class IPAddress<IPv6Address>
        Returns:
        A byte array representation of this IP address.

      • toIPv4

        public IPv4Address toIPv4()
        Returns an IPv4 representation of this IPv6 address if it is an IPv4 mapped address. This IPv4 address is equivalent to d.d.d.d if this IPv6 address is ::ffff:d.d.d.d.
        Returns:
        An IPv4 representation of this IPv6 address.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this IPv6 address is not an IPv4 mapped address.
        See Also:
        isIPv4Mapped()

      • isIPv4Mapped

        public boolean isIPv4Mapped()
        Returns whether or not this IPv6 address is an IPv4 mapped address. An IPv6 address is an IPv4 mapped address if it's in the ::ffff:0:0/96 subnet (from ::ffff:0:0 to ::ffff:ffff:ffff).
        Returns:
        true if this IPv6 address is an IPv4 mapped address, or false otherwise.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object o)
        Description copied from class: IPAddress
        Tests whether or not another object is equal to this IP address. An object is equal if it is a IP address with an equal return value of IPAddress.toByteArray().

        Implementations do not necessary need to use IPAddress.toByteArray(), as long as equal IP addresses also have equal byte array representations.

        Specified by:
        equals in class IPAddress<IPv6Address>

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Description copied from class: IPAddress
        Returns a hash code value for this IP address.

        Implementations do not necessarily need to use IPAddress.toByteArray(), as long as the general contract as specified by Object.hashCode() is not violated.

        Specified by:
        hashCode in class IPAddress<IPv6Address>

      • isMulticastAddress

        public boolean isMulticastAddress()
        Returns whether or not this IP address is an IP multicast address. This method returns whether or not the IP address is in subnet ff00::/8.
        Specified by:
        isMulticastAddress in class IPAddress<IPv6Address>
        Returns:
        true if this IP address is an IP multicast address, or false otherwise.

      • isLinkLocalAddress

        public boolean isLinkLocalAddress()
        Returns whether or not this IP address is a link local address. This method returns whether or not the IP address is in the fe80::/10 subnet.
        Specified by:
        isLinkLocalAddress in class IPAddress<IPv6Address>
        Returns:
        true if this IP address is a link local address, or false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Inet6Address.isLinkLocalAddress()

      • isSiteLocalAddress

        public boolean isSiteLocalAddress()
        Returns whether or not this IP address is a site local address. This method returns whether or not the IP address is in the fec0::/10 subnets.
        Specified by:
        isSiteLocalAddress in class IPAddress<IPv6Address>
        Returns:
        true if this IP address is a site local address, or false otherwise.

      • valueOf

        public static IPv6Address valueOf(int hextet1,
                                  int hextet2,
                                  int hextet3,
                                  int hextet4,
                                  int hextet5,
                                  int hextet6,
                                  int hextet7,
                                  int hextet8)
        Returns an IPv6 address from eight hextets. For example, valueOf(0xFF, 0xAB, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1) will return an IPv6 address that represents ff:ab::1.
        Parameters:
        hextet1 - The first hextet.
        hextet2 - The second hextet.
        hextet3 - The third hextet.
        hextet4 - The fourth hextet.
        hextet5 - The fifth hextet.
        hextet6 - The sixth hextet.
        hextet7 - The seventh hextet.
        hextet8 - The eighth hextet.
        Returns:
        An IPv6 address that represents the given hextets.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any of the octets is not between 0 and 0xFFFF, inclusive.

      • valueOf

        public static IPv6Address valueOf(byte[] address)
        Returns an IPv6 address from a byte array representation of the address.
        Parameters:
        address - The array to return an IPv6 address for.
        Returns:
        An IPv6 address that represents the given array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given array is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the length of the given array is not 16.

      • valueOf

        public static IPv6Address valueOf(CharSequence address)
        Returns an IPv6 address represented by a CharSequence.
        Parameters:
        address - The IPv6 address as a CharSequence.
        Returns:
        An IPv6 address that represents the given address.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given CharSequence is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given CharSequence does not represent a valid IPv6 address.

      • valueOf

        public static IPv6Address valueOf(CharSequence address,
                                  int start,
                                  int end)
        Returns an IPv6 address represented by a portion of a CharSequence.
        Parameters:
        address - The IPv6 address as a CharSequence.
        start - The index in the CharSequence where the IPv6 address starts, inclusive.
        end - The index in the CharSequence where the IPv6 address ends, exclusive.
        Returns:
        An IPv6 address that represents the given address.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given CharSequence is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the start index is negative, or if the end index is larger than the length of the CharSequence, or if the start index is larger than the end index.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given CharSequence does not represent a valid IPv6 address.
        Since:
        1.1

      • tryValueOfIPv6

        public static Optional<IPv6Address> tryValueOfIPv6(CharSequence address)
        Attempts to return an IPv6 address represented by a CharSequence.
        Parameters:
        address - The possible IPv6 address as a CharSequence.
        Returns:
        An Optional with the IPv6 address that represents the given address, or Optional.empty() if the given CharSequence is nullor does not represent a valid IPv6 address.

      • tryValueOfIPv6

        public static Optional<IPv6Address> tryValueOfIPv6(CharSequence address,
                                                   int start,
                                                   int end)
        Attempts to return an IPv6 address represented by a portion of a CharSequence.
        Parameters:
        address - The possible IPv6 address as a CharSequence.
        start - The index in the CharSequence where the IPv6 address starts, inclusive.
        end - The index in the CharSequence where the IPv6 address ends, exclusive.
        Returns:
        An Optional with the IPv6 address that represents the given address, or Optional.empty() if the given CharSequence is nullor does not represent a valid IPv6 address.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the start index is negative, or if the end index is larger than the length of the CharSequence, or if the start index is larger than the end index (unless if the CharSequence is null).
        Since:
        1.1

      • valueOf

        public static IPv6Address valueOf(Inet6Address address)
        Returns an IPv6 address represented by a Inet6Address.
        Parameters:
        address - The IPv6 address as a Inet6Address.
        Returns:
        An IPv6 address that represents the given address.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given Inet6Address is null.

      • isIPv6Address

        public static boolean isIPv6Address(CharSequence s)
        Tests whether or not a CharSequence is a valid IPv6 address.
        Parameters:
        s - The CharSequence to test.
        Returns:
        true if the given CharSequence is a valid IPv6 address, or false otherwise.

      • isIPv6Address

        public static boolean isIPv6Address(CharSequence s,
                                    int start,
                                    int end)
        Tests whether or not a portion of a CharSequence is a valid IPv6 address.
        Parameters:
        s - The CharSequence to test.
        start - The index in the CharSequence to start checking at, inclusive.
        end - The index in the CharSequence to end checking at, exclusive.
        Returns:
        true if the given CharSequence is a valid IPv6 address, or false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the start index is negative, or if the end index is larger than the length of the CharSequence, or if the start index is larger than the end index (unless if the CharSequence is null).
        Since:
        1.1

      • ifValidIPv6Address

        public static Predicate<CharSequence> ifValidIPv6Address(Predicate<? super IPv6Address> predicate)
        Returns a predicate that checks whether or not CharSequences are valid IPv6 addresses that match a specific predicate. This predicate can handle null values, which do not match the predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - The predicate to check if CharSequences are valid IP addresses.
        Returns:
        A predicate that checks whether or not CharSequences are valid IP addresses that match the given predicate.
        See Also:
        isIPv6Address(CharSequence)
